intro: Psephellus kopet-daghensis, commonly known as the Kopet-Dag psephellus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. It is often found in mountainous areas, where it thrives in full sun and low moisture. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
